result.execSummary:
The defendant James S. Hergert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $453 DOC Collect;  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
May Petition to Expunge upon successfully completing Probation, if eligible under Statute

records.addlTxt: Defendant James S. Hergert in court.  Mason C. Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court Sets Restitution at zero.
Defendant James S. Hergert in court.  Mark Matthew Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Restitution hearing scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 11:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for James S. Hergert
Current: 106 Rogers Street, Milton, WI 53563 United States  (Effective: 04-12-2016)
Prior: 214 Dunn St., Milton, WI 53563

Defendant James S. Hergert in court with attorney Scott K. Mccarthy.  Jodi Dabson Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Deft pleads No Contest freely and voluntarily to Amended Complaint; Court accepts plea and finds Deft Guilty; Court orders: Sentence withheld: 2 years Probation, each count Concurrent; Restitution to be determined; Costs DOC Collect; May Petition to Expunge umpon successfully completing Probation, if eligible under statute; AODA and any treatment necessary; 2 days credit, if Revoked. Atty McCarthy withdraws after sentencing, will not appear at Restitution Hearing;  Restitution hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
